page.title: 13Frankley Estate
page.content: This is a major housing programme of approximately 6,000 dwellings undertaken by Birmingham Distric Council on land owned by the City in South Birmingham and North Worcestershire. As most of Frankley is North Worcestershire, such services as {education}and {social services},{ {cleaning}and {refuse}, are provided by either the County Council of Hereford and Worcester or Bromsgrove District Council. The first houses were ready for occupation in February 1976. There are several different types of houses throughout the Estate, including one bedroomed bungalows, and flats in two storey blocks, two, three, and four bedroomed houses. G.R. 03980273 & 03990278
